results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Domestic Violence;Sex Crimes;#MeToo Movement;internal-storyline-no;FKA twigs;LaBeouf, Shia
results.byline: By Katie Benner and Melena Ryzik
results.title: FKA twigs Sues Shia LaBeouf, Citing ‘Relentless’ Abusive Relationship
results.abstract: The lawsuit, filed in Los Angeles by the musician, accuses the actor of sexual battery, assault and infliction of emotional distress.

media.caption: The musician FKA twigs, born Tahliah Debrett Barnett, filed a lawsuit in Los Angeles Superior Court that accuses the actor Shia LaBeouf of sexual battery, assault and infliction of emotional distress.
media.copyright: Ana Cuba for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Pence, Mike;Democratic Party;Republican Party;House of Representatives
results.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: Trump Allies Eye Long-Shot Election Reversal in Congress, Testing Pence
results.abstract: Some House Republicans plan to try to use Congress’s tallying of electoral results on Jan. 6 to tip the election to President Trump. The attempt will put Republicans in a pinch.

media.caption: The ensuing fight promises to shape how President Trump’s base views the election for years to come.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;States (US);Attorneys General;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Presidential Transition (US);Electoral College;Decisions and Verdicts;United States Politics and Government;Federal-State Relations (US);Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Paxton, Ken;Supreme Court (US);Texas
results.byline: By Adam Liptak
results.title: Supreme Court Rejects Texas Suit Seeking to Subvert Election
results.abstract: The suit, filed directly in the Supreme Court, sought to bar Georgia, Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin from casting their electoral votes for Joseph R. Biden Jr.

media.caption: The Supreme Court received more than a dozen friend-of-the-court briefs and motions seeking to intervene.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Drug Cartels;Kidnapping and Hostages;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Extortion and Blackmail;Organized Crime;Politics and Government;Content Type: Personal Profile;Rodriguez Martinez, Miriam Elizabeth;Leal Garza, Luciano;San Fernando (Tamaulipas, Mexico);Mexico
results.byline: By Azam Ahmed
results.title: She Stalked Her Daughter’s Killers Across Mexico, One by One
results.abstract: Armed with a handgun, a fake ID card and disguises, Miriam Rodríguez was a one-woman detective squad, defying a system where criminal impunity often prevails.

results.adx_keywords: Child Abuse and Neglect;Sex Crimes;Child Pornography;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Computers and the Internet;Women and Girls;Pornography;Human Trafficking;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Pornhub;MindGeek Sarl;Canada
results.byline: By Nicholas Kristof
results.title: The Children of Pornhub
results.abstract: Why does Canada allow this company to profit off videos of exploitation and assault?

media.caption: Serena K. Fleites, 19, was 14 when a boy she had a crush on asked her to make a naked video and send it to him. She did, and it ended up on Pornhub.
media.copyright: Rachel Bujalski for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Clinical Trials;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;your-feed-healthcare;Food and Drug Administration;BioNTech SE;Pfizer Inc
results.byline: By Katie Thomas, Noah Weiland and Sharon LaFraniere
results.title: F.D.A. Advisory Panel Gives Green Light to Pfizer Vaccine
results.abstract: The blessing of these experts means that the agency will likely OK the vaccine’s use, paving the way for health care workers to begin getting shots next week.

results.adx_keywords: Trump Tax Returns;Banking and Financial Institutions;Insurance;District Attorneys;Tax Evasion;Frauds and Swindling;Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Ivanka;Vance, Cyrus R Jr;Trump Organization;Deutsche Bank AG;Aon Corp;Manhattan (NYC)
results.byline: By William K. Rashbaum, Ben Protess and David Enrich
results.title: Manhattan D.A. Intensifies Investigation of Trump
results.abstract: Prosecutors have recently interviewed employees of President Trump’s lender and insurance brokerage, in the latest indication that he still faces the potential threat of criminal charges once he leaves office.

media.caption: When President Trump returns to private life in January, he will lose the protection from criminal prosecution that his office has afforded him.

results.adx_keywords: Women and Girls;Discrimination;Education;First Ladies (US);United States Politics and Government;Biden, Jill Tracy Jacobs;Epstein, Joseph;Wall Street Journal
results.byline: By Michael Levenson
results.title: An Opinion Writer Argued Jill Biden Should Drop the ‘Dr.’ (Few Were Swayed.)
results.abstract: Many women said Joseph Epstein’s suggestion in The Wall Street Journal was blatantly sexist and underscored the way men often dismiss women’s credentials.

media.caption: Jill Biden holds two master’s degrees and a doctorate in education from the University of Delaware.
media.copyright: Eve Edelheit for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-essential
results.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere, Katie Thomas and Noah Weiland
results.title: Trump administration officials passed when Pfizer offered months ago to sell the U.S. more vaccine doses.

media.caption: The Trump administration is said to have turned down an offer from Pfizer to purchase additional doses of its vaccine.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Mascots;Native Americans;Names, Organizational;Discrimination;Race and Ethnicity;Cleveland Indians;Major League Baseball
results.byline: By David Waldstein and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: Cleveland’s Baseball Team Will Drop Its Indians Team Name
results.abstract: The decision comes amid a wider push for sports teams to stop using Native American names and imagery as team names and mascots.

media.caption: Shane Bieber won the 2020 American League Cy Young Award for Cleveland. The team already has uniform options that do not incorporate its former name.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Elections, Governors;Endorsements;United States Politics and Government;Kemp, Brian P;Ducey, Doug (1964- );Collins, Douglas A (1966- );Loeffler, Kelly L;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Georgia;Arizona
results.byline: By Richard Fausset and Lisa Lerer
results.title: Brian Kemp Cast His Lot With Trump, and Has Now Paid the Price
results.abstract: Mr. Kemp rose to Georgia’s governorship with the help of President Trump, but his refusal to try to overturn the state’s election results has drawn Mr. Trump’s ire — and may affect his political future.

media.caption: Gov. Brian Kemp of Georgia has taken pains to demonstrate his conservative credentials throughout his career.

results.byline: By Jack Nicas
results.title: He Pretended to Be Trump’s Family. Then Trump Fell for It.
results.abstract: For months, a 21-year-old Trump supporter impersonated Trump family members on Twitter, spreading conspiracy theories, asking for money and eventually drawing the attention of the president.

results.byline: By Adam Liptak
results.title: Supreme Court Rejects Republican Challenge to Pennsylvania Vote
results.abstract: In a one-sentence order, the court refused to overturn election results that had already been certified and submitted.

media.caption: A “Stop the Steal” rally on Tuesday outside the Supreme Court.
media.copyright: Anna Moneymaker for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Masks;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Immune System;Disease Rates;Clinical Trials;Nose;Throat;Antibodies;your-feed-science;Moderna Inc;Pfizer Inc
results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli
results.title: Here’s Why Vaccinated People Still Need to Wear a Mask
results.abstract: The new vaccines will probably prevent you from getting sick with Covid. No one knows yet whether they will keep you from spreading the virus to others — but that information is coming.

media.caption: Scientists worry that if vaccinated people are silent spreaders of the virus, they may keep it circulating in their communities, putting unvaccinated people at risk.
media.copyright: Max Whittaker for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Clinical Trials;your-feed-healthcare;Hahn, Stephen M (1960- );Food and Drug Administration;BioNTech SE;Pfizer Inc;United States
results.byline: By Katie Thomas, Sharon LaFraniere, Noah Weiland, Abby Goodnough and Maggie Haberman
results.title: F.D.A. Clears Pfizer Vaccine, and Millions of Doses Will Be Shipped Right Away
results.abstract: An initial shipment of about 2.9 million doses of the vaccine will be sent around the United States over the next week.

media.caption: Pfizer has said it will be able to supply up to 25 million doses before the end of the year, and 100 million total vaccines by March.

results.adx_keywords: Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Presidential Election of 2020;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Rumors and Misinformation;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Supreme Court (US);Proud Boys;Olympia (Wash);Washington (DC);Atlanta (Ga)
results.byline: By Hailey Fuchs, Pranshu Verma and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: 4 Stabbed and One Shot as Trump Supporters and Opponents Clash
results.abstract: Supporters of the president in several cities said they were still convinced that the election was stolen, no matter what the courts say. Some confrontations with counterprotesters turned violent.

media.caption: Supporters of President Trump and counterdemonstrators clashed in Washington on Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: Cyberwarfare and Defense;Cyberattacks and Hackers;Computer Security;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Computers and the Internet;FireEye Inc;Federal Bureau of Investigation;National Security Agency;Russia
results.byline: By David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth
results.title: FireEye, a Top Cybersecurity Firm, Says It Was Hacked by a Nation-State
results.abstract: The Silicon Valley company said hackers — almost certainly Russian — made off with tools that could be used to mount new attacks around the world.

media.caption: FireEye’s clients after huge breaches have included Sony and Equifax. Hackers targeted its “Red Team” tools.

results.adx_keywords: Cyberwarfare and Defense;Computer Security;United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2020;Presidential Election of 2016;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Classified Information and State Secrets;Trump, Donald J;Commerce Department;Treasury Department;Homeland Security Department;National Security Agency;National Security Council;FireEye Inc;SolarWinds;National Telecommunications and Information Administration;Russia
results.byline: By David E. Sanger
results.title: Russian Hackers Broke Into Federal Agencies, U.S. Officials Suspect
results.abstract: In one of the most sophisticated and perhaps largest hacks in more than five years, email systems were breached at the Treasury and Commerce Departments. Other breaches are under investigation.

media.caption: The Treasury Department was one of the agencies targeted by the hackers.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Electoral College;Attorneys General;Constitution (US);Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);United States Politics and Government;Federal-State Relations (US);Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Paxton, Ken;Supreme Court (US);Georgia;Michigan;Pennsylvania;Wisconsin;Texas
results.byline: By Adam Liptak and Jeremy W. Peters
results.title: In Blistering Retort, 4 Battleground States Tell Texas to Butt Out of Election
results.abstract: The attorneys general of Pennsylvania, Michigan, Wisconsin and Georgia asked the Supreme Court to reject a lawsuit from Texas seeking to overturn President-elect Joe Biden’s victories.

media.caption: President Trump greeted Attorney General Ken Paxton in Austin, Texas, earlier this year. Mr. Paxton filed a lawsuit that seeks to overturn state victories by President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Clinical Trials;Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Food and Drug Administration;Pfizer Inc;BioNTech SE
results.byline: By Noah Weiland and Carl Zimmer
results.title: Pfizer’s Vaccine Offers Strong Protection After First Dose
results.abstract: The Food and Drug Administration’s first analysis of the clinical trial data also found that the coronavirus vaccine worked well regardless of a volunteer’s race, weight or age.

media.caption: A nurse at the Royal Free Hospital in London simulating the administration of Pfizer’s vaccine during a training session last week.
